Dialogue.NPCText:
A young woman arranges flowers on a delicate lacquered cart. She looks up, reading your face with a gentle smile.

“Ah, traveler! Welcome to Hinokami’s blossom market. I am Kiku. May I offer you petals to reflect your spirit... or perhaps something to heal the heart?”

(You notice she somehow seems to know how you’re feeling before you speak.)

Option.text: I’m curious about your flowers.
How did you know how I feel?
Are you taking part in the festival?
Do you need help gathering rare blooms?
Tell me more about yourself, Kiku.
I just want to buy some flowers.
Farewell, Kiku.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku bows and gestures to her cart.

“Every flower has a secret meaning. Cherry blossoms for hope, irises for courage, white lilies for peace. I choose what fits your heart’s colors.”
She pauses, selecting a blossom.
“Right now... you carry the scent of [emotion] about you. May I offer something to match, or to help you change?”

Option.text: What do you sense in me?
I’d like something for hope.
I’d like something for peace.
Maybe something for courage?
Tell me more about the meanings.
Thank you, I’ll browse for now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku laughs softly.

“People wear their moods like auras. I do not need magic—flowers simply whisper what is needed, if one listens.”
She offers a blossom, chosen to match your mood.
(If you bring her rare blooms, she may reveal secret meanings.)

Option.text: Do certain flowers grant special blessings?
What if I bring you a rare flower?
That’s a lovely gift. Thank you.
I must go now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku tucks the chosen flower gently behind your ear or in your hair.
“May this bring you gentle fortune today. If you return with rare petals from the wilds, I can share even deeper secrets… or weave a charm for you.”
(You feel subtly lighter, as if your burdens eased.)

Option.text: I’ll seek rare flowers for you!
Thank you, Kiku. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku’s eyes twinkle as she recites:
“Cherry blossom: fleeting hope.
Iris: steadfast courage.
Lily: gentle peace.
Camellia: devotion.
Orchid: hidden beauty.
Each has a secret if given at the right time or to the right person.”
She smiles, inviting you to look closer.
“In Hinokami, flowers can open doors… and sometimes, hearts.”

Option.text: Can you make a special charm if I bring you something rare?
Thank you for the lesson.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Yes! The Blossom Festival is soon, honoring our sun goddess and ancestors. There will be dance, lanterns, and the making of petal charms. If you bring me a **Moon Lotus** or **Sakura Dewdrop**, I can make you a charm that shines during the night parade.”
She looks hopeful.
“Will you help me find these blooms?”

Option.text: I will search for a Moon Lotus.
What is a Sakura Dewdrop?
Maybe another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku brightens.
“Sometimes, petals from outside Hinokami carry new omens. I hear the **Frostmere Blue Orchid** is guarded by icy spirits, and the **Sunreach Firebloom** only opens at dawn. Bring me any rare flower, and I will craft a charm to match its story.”
(You sense she’ll reward you differently based on what you bring.)

Option.text: What can you do with a Frostmere Blue Orchid?
What about a Sunreach Firebloom?
I will return if I find something rare.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku’s eyes widen.
“The Blue Orchid holds the spirit of winter. If you bring me one, I will make you a charm of ice—said to ward off sorrow and protect travelers in cold lands.”
(Bring her a Frostmere Blue Orchid to unlock a unique reward.)

Option.text: I have a Frostmere Blue Orchid for you.
Not yet, but I will return.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku weaves the blue orchid into a delicate bracelet.
“Wear this, and sorrow will find you slower. Thank you for bringing a little winter to Hinokami’s spring.”
(You feel more resilient to cold and melancholy.)

Option.text: Thank you, Kiku.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Firebloom? That flower is brave as sunrise. With it, I can make a charm to spark your courage—even in Minax’s darkest shadow.”
(Bring her a Sunreach Firebloom for a different reward.)

Option.text: I have a Sunreach Firebloom for you.
Option.action: GiveItem:CharmOfDawnCourage(1);RemoveItem:SunreachFirebloom(1);SendMessage:You feel emboldened, as if dawn broke within your heart.

Option.text: Not yet, but I will return.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku binds the fiery petals with a red silk thread.
“This will light your spirit when courage runs low. Carry it when facing great peril.”
(A spark of confidence flares in your chest.)

Option.text: Thank you, Kiku.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The Moon Lotus only blooms beneath a full moon. If you bring one, I’ll craft a charm to guide you safely through dreams and shadows.”
(Find a Moon Lotus and return here for a festival reward.)

Option.text: I will bring you a Moon Lotus.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“A Sakura Dewdrop is a petal kissed by morning dew from the oldest cherry tree. It is rare—said to reveal the path to hidden beauty.”
She smiles, “Bring one, and I will share a charm for seeing the unseen.”

Option.text: I’ll look for one!

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku smiles wistfully, adjusting a stray blossom in her cart.

“There isn’t much to tell… or perhaps, too much hidden among petals.”
She closes her eyes briefly.
“I was once trained to be a shrine maiden in Tokuno, before the flames of Minax fell. When we fled, I brought only seeds, my heart, and my teacher’s bell.”

“Now, I serve as a voice for flowers. And sometimes, perhaps, they speak back.”

Option.text: You were a shrine maiden? That sounds important.
How do you speak to flowers?
What happened when you fled Tokuno?
That bell you mentioned...?
You must miss your old life.
Thank you for sharing that with me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“It was a life of silence and discipline. We served Amateru through offerings, lanterns, and poetry. I thought I would grow old tending her shrine… until it burned beneath Minax’s falling stars.”
She touches her sleeve reverently.
“Now, each flower I sell is an offering. To her. To memory.”

Option.text: Your devotion is admirable.
I’d like to offer something at your cart, in her honor.
Let us speak of lighter things.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Flowers speak through the way they bloom. Their colors, scents, the places they choose to grow. When I touch a blossom, I feel its purpose—joy, protection, mourning.”
She holds up a red camellia.
“This one tells me you’ve recently taken a great risk… Am I wrong?”

Option.text: You’re right. How did you know?
Maybe flowers know more than we do.
Let’s talk about something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku bows gently.
“Then you carry both weight… and wisdom. Let this flower guide your recovery.”
She pins the red camellia to your sleeve.

(You feel stronger, emotionally fortified.)

Option.text: Thank you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku’s voice lowers.
“Minax unleashed fire from the sky. My family fled to the docks. My mother… she didn’t make it.”
She looks away, holding back tears.
“We sailed through storm and shadow. Hinokami is all I have now. And my cart. And the petals.”

Option.text: I’m so sorry.
Minax will pay for what she’s done.
How can I honor her memory?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She nods quietly.
“Thank you. When people take the time to *see* others… it matters more than words.”

Option.text: You’re not alone in this.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku’s eyes narrow slightly, then soften.
“Even flowers need warriors. Just… do not let revenge twist your roots. Grow toward the sun.”
She places a white petal in your palm.

Option.text: I will remember your words.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She holds out a tiny silver bell strung with violet thread.
“This was my teacher’s. It rang only for rites of passage or when we spoke to spirits.”
She tilts her head.
“It’s silent now. But when the cherry blossoms fall just right, I sometimes hear it again.”

Option.text: Can you use it to bless someone?
I hope it rings again someday.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku’s eyes brighten.
“Would you accept a quiet blessing?”
She raises the bell, its tone faint as wind through reeds.
(You feel spiritually cleansed.)

Option.text: I accept.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Some days I miss it all. My temple. The gardens. The tea.”
She exhales slowly.
“But even fallen blossoms nourish the soil. Hinokami is my garden now.”

Option.text: Then you’ve made something beautiful from pain.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku clasps her hands together.
“Thank you for your kindness. The shrine may be gone, but the spirit lives on. I’ll use your offering to plant more in her name.”
(Karma increased.)

Option.text: May they bloom brightly.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kiku smiles with quiet warmth.
“You’ve shown me kindness. Let me offer something in return.”
She gifts you a small sachet filled with fragrant petals.
“May it soothe the nights ahead.”

Option.text: Thank you, Kiku.
